flawed_nl_solution:
Of her original 25 apples, Sarah gave five to friends, meaning she has no more than 25-5=<<25-5=20>>20 apples available to give to teachers.
She ate one while walking home, meaning she had no more than 20-1=<<20-1=19>>19 apples available to give to teachers.
And since she had three apples remaining when she got home, then the amount she had given to teachers was 19-3=<<19-3=15>>15 apples.
#### 15

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 15. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
